DOC.brief_summary: This study evaluate adherence four type walk program . Participants randomize walk program include either ( 1 ) affect-based exercise intensity , ( 2 ) self-selected ( `` choice-based '' ) exercise intensity , ( 3 ) heart-rate base exercise intensity , ( 4 ) heart-rate guide exercise intensity emphasis affective benefit .
DOC.brief_title: Comparison Affect-based , Self-selected , Traditional Exercise Prescriptions
DOC.detailed_description: The purpose study determine `` affect-based '' `` choice-based '' exercise prescription effective behavior change traditional , `` moderate-intensity '' exercise prescription . Prior research suggest `` choice-based '' `` self-selected '' exercise intensity pleasant adhere `` moderate-intensity exercise '' ( Williams et al. , 2014 ) . Similarly , affect-based exercise prescription ( i.e. , exercise prescription intensity regulate base pleasure-displeasure one feel exercise ) appear merit ( Baldwin , Kangas , Denman , Smits , Yamada , & Otto , 2016 ) . However , choice-based affect-based exercise prescription compare . Further , unknown intensity regulation matter ( e.g. , `` choose intensity feel good '' focus affect ( e.g. , `` focus feel good ) . Third , prior research objectively measure physical activity behavior .
DOC.criteria: Must fluent English Must able walk Exercise le 90 minute per week moderateintensity Must able attend laboratory visit Must mobile internet accent personal smartphone ( iPhone iOS 9+ Android OS 4.3+ ) Can safely exercise intensity least `` moderate '' People recommend medical clearance prior exercising , accord American College Sports Medicine 's preparticipation screening criterion , exclude
